text: The disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom he spoke.

name: John 13:23
text: One of his disciples, whom Jesus loved, was at the table, leaning against Jesus" breast.

name: John 13:24
text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, and said to him, "Tell us who it is of whom he speaks."

name: John 13:25
text: He, leaning back, as he was, on Jesus" breast, asked him, "Lord, who is it?"

name: John 13:26
text: Jesus therefore answered, "It is he to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it." So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

name: John 13:27
text: After the piece of bread, then Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said to him, "What you do, do quickly."

name: John 13:28
text: Now no man at the table knew why he said this to him.

name: John 13:29
text: For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus said to him, "Buy what things we need for the feast," or that he should give something to the poor.

name: John 13:30
text: Therefore, having received that morsel, he went out immediately. It was night.

name: John 13:31
text: When he had gone out, Jesus said, "Now the Son of Man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in him.

name: John 13:32
text: If God has been glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him immediately.

name: John 13:33
text: Little children, I will be with you a little while longer. You will seek me, and as I said to the Jews, "Where I am going, you can"t come," so now I tell you.

name: John 13:34
text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another, just like I have loved you; that you also love one another.

name: John 13:35
text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another."

name: John 13:36
text: Simon Peter said to him, "Lord, where are you going?" Jesus answered, "Where I am going, you can"t follow now, but you will follow afterwards."

name: John 13:37
text: Peter said to him, "Lord, why can"t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you."

name: John 13:38
text: Jesus answered him, "Will you lay down your life for me? Most certainly I tell you, the rooster won"t crow until you have denied me three times.

name: John 14:1
text: "Don"t let your heart be troubled. Believe in God. Believe also in me.

name: John 14:2
text: In my Father"s house are many homes. If it weren"t so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.

name: John 14:3
text: If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.

name: John 14:4
text: Where I go, you know, and you know the way."

name: John 14:5
text: Thomas said to him, "Lord, we don"t know where you are going. How can we know the way?"

name: John 14:6
text: Jesus said to him, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.

name: John 14:7
text: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on, you know him, and have seen him."

name: John 14:8
text: Philip said to him, "Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us."

name: John 14:9
text: Jesus said to him, "Have I been with you such a long time, and do you not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How do you say, "Show us the Father?"

name: John 14:10
text: Don"t you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? The words that I tell you, I speak not from myself; but the Father who lives in me does his works.

name: John 14:11
text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works" sake.

name: John 14:12
text: Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.

name: John 14:13
text: Whatever you will ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

name: John 14:14
text: If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.

name: John 14:15
text: If you love me, keep my commandments.

name: John 14:16
text: I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Counselor, that he may be with you forever,"

name: John 14:17
text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world can"t receive; for it doesn"t see him, neither knows him. You know him, for he lives with you, and will be in you.

name: John 14:18
text: I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.

name: John 14:19
text: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

name: John 14:20
text: In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.

name: John 14:21
text: One who has my commandments, and keeps them, that person is one who loves me. One who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and will reveal myself to him."

name: John 14:22
text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, "Lord, what has happened that you are about to reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?"

name: John 14:23
text: Jesus answered him, "If a man loves me, he will keep my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him, and make our home with him.

name: John 14:24
text: He who doesn"t love me doesn"t keep my words. The word which you hear isn"t mine, but the Father"s who sent me.

name: John 14:25
text: I have said these things to you, while still living with you.

name: John 14:26
text: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things, and will remind you of all that I said to you.

name: John 14:27
text: Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, give I to you. Don"t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.

name: John 14:28
text: You heard how I told you, "I go away, and I come to you." If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I said "I am going to my Father;" for the Father is greater than I.

name: John 14:29
text: Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.

name: John 14:30
text: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world comes, and he has nothing in me.

name: John 14:31
text: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.

name: John 15:1
text: "I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.

name: John 15:2
text: Every branch in me that doesn"t bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.

name: John 15:3
text: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.

name: John 15:4
text: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can"t bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.

name: John 15:5
text: I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.

name: John 15:6
text: If a man doesn"t remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.

name: John 15:7
text: If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it will be done for you.

name: John 15:8
text: "In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit; and so you will be my disciples.

name: John 15:9
text: Even as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Remain in my love.

name: John 15:10
text: If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father"s commandments, and remain in his love.

name: John 15:11
text: I have spoken these things to you, that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.

name: John 15:12
text: "This is my commandment, that you love one another, even as I have loved you.

name: John 15:13
text: Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.

name: John 15:14
text: You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.

name: John 15:15
text: No longer do I call you servants, for the servant doesn"t know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.

name: John 15:16
text: You didn"t choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name, he may give it to you.

name: John 15:17
text: "I command these things to you, that you may love one another.

name: John 15:18
text: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me before it hated you.

name: John 15:19
text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

name: John 15:20
text: Remember the word that I said to you: "A servant is not greater than his lord." If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will keep yours also.

name: John 15:21
text: But all these things will they do to you for my name"s sake, because they don"t know him who sent me.

name: John 15:22
text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

name: John 15:23
text: He who hates me, hates my Father also.

name: John 15:24
text: If I hadn"t done among them the works which no one else did, they wouldn"t have had sin. But now have they seen and also hated both me and my Father.

name: John 15:25
text: But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, "They hated me without a cause."

name: John 15:26
text: "When the Counselor has come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me.

name: John 15:27
text: You will also testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.

name: John 16:1
text: "These things have I spoken to you, so that you wouldn"t be caused to stumble.

name: John 16:2
text: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time comes that whoever kills you will think that he offers service to God.

name: John 16:3
text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.

name: John 16:4
text: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn"t tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.

name: John 16:5
text: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, "Where are you going?"

name: John 16:6
text: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.

name: John 16:7
text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don"t go away, the Counselor won"t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.

name: John 16:8
text: When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;

name: John 16:9
text: about sin, because they don"t believe in me;

name: John 16:10
text: about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won"t see me any more;

name: John 16:11
text: about judgment, because the prince of this world has been judged.

name: John 16:12
text: "I have yet many things to tell you, but you can"t bear them now.

name: John 16:13
text: However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.

name: John 16:14
text: He will glorify me, for he will take from what is mine, and will declare it to you.

name: John 16:15
text: All things whatever the Father has are mine; therefore I said that he takes of mine, and will declare it to you.

name: John 16:16
text: A little while, and you will not see me. Again a little while, and you will see me."

name: John 16:17
text: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, "What is this that he says to us, "A little while, and you won"t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;" and, "Because I go to the Father?""

name: John 16:18
text: They said therefore, "What is this that he says, "A little while?" We don"t know what he is saying."

name: John 16:19
text: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, "Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, "A little while, and you won"t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?"

name: John 16:20
text: Most certainly I tell you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

name: John 16:21
text: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn"t remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.

name: John 16:22
text: Therefore you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.

name: John 16:23
text: "In that day you will ask me no questions. Most certainly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.

name: John 16:24
text: Until now, you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be made full.

name: John 16:25
text: I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. But the time is coming when I will no more speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.

name: John 16:26
text: In that day you will ask in my name; and I don"t say to you, that I will pray to the Father for you,

name: John 16:27
text: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came forth from God.

name: John 16:28
text: I came out from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father."

name: John 16:29
text: His disciples said to him, "Behold, now you speak plainly, and speak no figures of speech.

name: John 16:30
text: Now we know that you know all things, and don"t need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came forth from God."

name: John 16:31
text: Jesus answered them, "Do you now believe?

name: John 16:32
text: Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

name: John 16:33
text: I have told you these things, that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but cheer up! I have overcome the world."

name: John 17:1
text: Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, "Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may also glorify you;

name: John 17:2
text: even as you gave him authority over all flesh, he will give eternal life to all whom you have given him.

name: John 17:3
text: This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ.

name: John 17:4
text: I glorified you on the earth. I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do.

name: John 17:5
text: Now, Father, glorify me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world existed.

name: John 17:6
text: I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word.

name: John 17:7
text: Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you,

name: John 17:8
text: for the words which you have given me I have given to them, and they received them, and knew for sure that I came forth from you, and they have believed that you sent me.

name: John 17:9
text: I pray for them. I don"t pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours.

name: John 17:10
text: All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.

name: John 17:11
text: I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are.

name: John 17:12
text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

name: John 17:13
text: But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves.

name: John 17:14
text: I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

name: John 17:15
text: I pray not that you would take them from the world, but that you would keep them from the evil one.

name: John 17:16
text: They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.

name: John 17:17
text: Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.

name: John 17:18
text: As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.

name: John 17:19
text: For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.

name: John 17:20
text: Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who believe in me through their word,

name: John 17:21
text: that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us; that the world may believe that you sent me.

name: John 17:22
text: The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;

name: John 17:23
text: I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me.

name: John 17:24
text: Father, I desire that they also whom you have given me be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which you have given me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.

name: John 17:25
text: Righteous Father, the world hasn"t known you, but I knew you; and these knew that you sent me.

name: John 17:26
text: I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them."

name: John 18:1
text: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where there was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered.

name: John 18:2
text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with his disciples.

name: John 18:3
text: Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

name: John 18:4
text: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were happening to him, went forth, and said to them, "Who are you looking for?"

name: John 18:5
text: They answered him, "Jesus of Nazareth." Jesus said to them, "I am he." Judas also, who betrayed him, was standing with them.

name: John 18:6
text: When therefore he said to them, "I am he," they went backward, and fell to the ground.

name: John 18:7
text: Again therefore he asked them, "Who are you looking for?" They said, "Jesus of Nazareth."

name: John 18:8
text: Jesus answered, "I told you that I am he. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,"

name: John 18:9
text: that the word might be fulfilled which he spoke, "Of those whom you have given me, I have lost none."

name: John 18:10
text: Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it, and struck the high priest"s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant"s name was Malchus.

name: John 18:11
text: Jesus therefore said to Peter, "Put the sword into its sheath. The cup which the Father has given me, shall I not surely drink it?"

name: John 18:12
text: So the detachment, the commanding officer, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him,

name: John 18:13
text: and led him to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

name: John 18:14
text: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should perish for the people.

name: John 18:15
text: Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;

name: John 18:16
text: but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought in Peter.

name: John 18:17
text: Then the maid who kept the door said to Peter, "Are you also one of this man"s disciples?" He said, "I am not."

name: John 18:18
text: Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. They were warming themselves. Peter was with them, standing and warming himself.

name: John 18:19
text: The high priest therefore asked Jesus about his disciples, and about his teaching.

name: John 18:20
text: Jesus answered him, "I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where the Jews always meet. I said nothing in secret.

name: John 18:21
text: Why do you ask me? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them. Behold, these know the things which I said."

name: John 18:22
text: When he had said this, one of the officers standing by slapped Jesus with his hand, saying, "Do you answer the high priest like that?"

name: John 18:23
text: Jesus answered him, "If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why do you beat me?"

name: John 18:24
text: Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest.

name: John 18:25
text: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him, "You aren"t also one of his disciples, are you?" He denied it, and said, "I am not."

name: John 18:26
text: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said, "Didn"t I see you in the garden with him?"

name: John 18:27
text: Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed.

name: John 18:28
text: They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium. It was early, and they themselves didn"t enter into the Praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.

name: John 18:29
text: Pilate therefore went out to them, and said, "What accusation do you bring against this man?"

name: John 18:30
text: They answered him, "If this man weren"t an evildoer, we wouldn"t have delivered him up to you."

name: John 18:31
text: Pilate therefore said to them, "Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law." Therefore the Jews said to him, "It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,"

name: John 18:32
text: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying by what kind of death he should die.

name: John 18:33
text: Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to him, "Are you the King of the Jews?"

name: John 18:34
text: Jesus answered him, "Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?"

name: John 18:35
text: Pilate answered, "I"m not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?"

name: John 18:36
text: Jesus answered, "My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn"t be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here."

name: John 18:37
text: Pilate therefore said to him, "Are you a king then?" Jesus answered, "You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice."

name: John 18:38
text: Pilate said to him, "What is truth?" When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, "I find no basis for a charge against him.

name: John 18:39
text: But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Therefore do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?"

name: John 18:40
text: Then they all shouted again, saying, "Not this man, but Barabbas!" Now Barabbas was a robber.

name: John 19:1
text: So Pilate then took Jesus, and flogged him.

name: John 19:2
text: The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, and put it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment.

name: John 19:3
text: They kept saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!" and they kept slapping him.

name: John 19:4
text: Then Pilate went out again, and said to them, "Behold, I bring him out to you, that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him."

name: John 19:5
text: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them, "Behold, the man!"

name: John 19:6
text: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they shouted, saying, "Crucify! Crucify!" Pilate said to them, "Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him."

name: John 19:7
text: The Jews answered him, "We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God."

name: John 19:8
text: When therefore Pilate heard this saying, he was more afraid.

name: John 19:9
text: He entered into the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus, "Where are you from?" But Jesus gave him no answer.

name: John 19:10
text: Pilate therefore said to him, "Aren"t you speaking to me? Don"t you know that I have power to release you, and have power to crucify you?"

name: John 19:11
text: Jesus answered, "You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin."

name: John 19:12
text: At this, Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying, "If you release this man, you aren"t Caesar"s friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!"

name: John 19:13
text: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called "The Pavement," but in Hebrew, "Gabbatha."

name: John 19:14
text: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews, "Behold, your King!"

name: John 19:15
text: They cried out, "Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!" Pilate said to them, "Shall I crucify your King?" The chief priests answered, "We have no king but Caesar!"

name: John 19:16
text: So then he delivered him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led him away.

name: John 19:17
text: He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called "The Place of a Skull," which is called in Hebrew, "Golgotha,"

name: John 19:18
text: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on either side one, and Jesus in the middle.

name: John 19:19
text: Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. There was written, "JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS."

name: John 19:20
text: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

name: John 19:21
text: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, "Don"t write, "The King of the Jews," but, "he said, I am King of the Jews.""

name: John 19:22
text: Pilate answered, "What I have written, I have written."

name: John 19:23
text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

name: John 19:24
text: Then they said to one another, "Let"s not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be," that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which says, "They parted my garments among them. For my cloak they cast lots." Therefore the soldiers did these things.

name: John 19:25
text: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother"s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

name: John 19:26
text: Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, "Woman, behold your son!"

name: John 19:27
text: Then he said to the disciple, "Behold, your mother!" From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

name: John 19:28
text: After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, "I am thirsty."

name: John 19:29
text: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

name: John 19:30
text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, "It is finished." He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

name: John 19:31
text: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn"t remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

name: John 19:32
text: Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him;

name: John 19:33
text: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn"t break his legs.

name: John 19:34
text: However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

name: John 19:35
text: He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe.

name: John 19:36
text: For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, "A bone of him will not be broken."

name: John 19:37
text: Again another Scripture says, "They will look on him whom they pierced."

name: John 19:38
text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away Jesus" body. Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.

name: John 19:39
text: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.

name: John 19:40
text: So they took Jesus" body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

name: John 19:41
text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid.

name: John 19:42
text: Then because of the Jews" Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

name: John 20:1
text: Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

name: John 20:2
text: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, "They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don"t know where they have laid him!"

name: John 20:3
text: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.

name: John 20:4
text: They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first.

name: John 20:5
text: Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn"t enter in.

name: John 20:6
text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,

name: John 20:7
text: and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

name: John 20:8
text: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.

name: John 20:9
text: For as yet they didn"t know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

name: John 20:10
text: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.

name: John 20:11
text: But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb,

name: John 20:12
text: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

name: John 20:13
text: They told her, "Woman, why are you weeping?" She said to them, "Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don"t know where they have laid him."

name: John 20:14
text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn"t know that it was Jesus.

name: John 20:15
text: Jesus said to her, "Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?" She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him, "Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away."

name: John 20:16
text: Jesus said to her, "Mary." She turned and said to him, "Rabboni!" which is to say, "Teacher!"

name: John 20:17
text: Jesus said to her, "Don"t hold me, for I haven"t yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, "I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.""

name: John 20:18
text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had said these things to her.

name: John 20:19
text: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them, "Peace be to you."

name: John 20:20
text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.

name: John 20:21
text: Jesus therefore said to them again, "Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you."

name: John 20:22
text: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them, "Receive the Holy Spirit!

name: John 20:23
text: If you forgive anyone"s sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone"s sins, they have been retained."

name: John 20:24
text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn"t with them when Jesus came.

name: John 20:25
text: The other disciples therefore said to him, "We have seen the Lord!" But he said to them, "Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe."

name: John 20:26
text: After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the midst, and said, "Peace be to you."

name: John 20:27
text: Then he said to Thomas, "Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don"t be unbelieving, but believing."

name: John 20:28
text: Thomas answered him, "My Lord and my God!"

name: John 20:29
text: Jesus said to him, "Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed."

name: John 20:30
text: Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

name: John 20:31
text: but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

name: John 21:1
text: After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way.

name: John 21:2
text: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together.

name: John 21:3
text: Simon Peter said to them, "I"m going fishing." They told him, "We are also coming with you." They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing.

name: John 21:4
text: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn"t know that it was Jesus.

name: John 21:5
text: Jesus therefore said to them, "Children, have you anything to eat?" They answered him, "No."

name: John 21:6
text: He said to them, "Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some." They cast it therefore, and now they weren"t able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.

name: John 21:7
text: That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter, "It"s the Lord!" So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.

name: John 21:8
text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.

name: John 21:9
text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.

name: John 21:10
text: Jesus said to them, "Bring some of the fish which you have just caught."

name: John 21:11
text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn"t torn.

name: John 21:12
text: Jesus said to them, "Come and eat breakfast." None of the disciples dared inquire of him, "Who are you?" knowing that it was the Lord.

name: John 21:13
text: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

name: John 21:14
text: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

name: John 21:15
text: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?" He said to him, "Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you." He said to him, "Feed my lambs."

name: John 21:16
text: He said to him again a second time, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?" He said to him, "Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you." He said to him, "Tend my sheep."

name: John 21:17
text: He said to him the third time, "Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?" Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, "Do you have affection for me?" He said to him, "Lord, you know everything. You know that I have affection for you." Jesus said to him, "Feed my sheep.

name: John 21:18
text: Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don"t want to go."

name: John 21:19
text: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him, "Follow me."

name: John 21:20
text: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus" breast at the supper and asked, "Lord, who is going to betray You?"

name: John 21:21
text: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus, "Lord, what about this man?"

name: John 21:22
text: Jesus said to him, "If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me."

name: John 21:23
text: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn"t die. Yet Jesus didn"t say to him that he wouldn"t die, but, "If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?"

name: John 21:24
text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

name: John 21:25
text: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn"t have room for the books that would be written.

name: Acts 1:1
text: The first book I wrote, Theophilus, concerned all that Jesus began both to do and to teach,

name: Acts 1:2
text: until the day in which he was received up, after he had given commandment through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen.

name: Acts 1:3
text: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God"s Kingdom.

name: Acts 1:4
text: Being assembled together with them, he commanded them, "Don"t depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

name: Acts 1:5
text: For John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days from now."

name: Acts 1:6
text: Therefore, when they had come together, they asked him, "Lord, are you now restoring the kingdom to Israel?"

name: Acts 1:7
text: He said to them, "It isn"t for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within his own authority.

name: Acts 1:8
text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth."

name: Acts 1:9
text: When he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight.

name: Acts 1:10
text: While they were looking steadfastly into the sky as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing,

name: Acts 1:11
text: who also said, "You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky."

name: Acts 1:12
text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day"s journey away.

name: Acts 1:13
text: When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying; that is Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

name: Acts 1:14
text: All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

name: Acts 1:15
text: In these days, Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said,

name: Acts 1:16
text: "Brothers, it was necessary that this Scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus.

name: Acts 1:17
text: For he was numbered with us, and received his portion in this ministry.

name: Acts 1:18
text: Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out.

name: Acts 1:19
text: It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called "Akeldama," that is, "The field of blood."

name: Acts 1:20
text: For it is written in the book of Psalms, "Let his habitation be made desolate. Let no one dwell therein;" and, "Let another take his office."

name: Acts 1:21
text: "Of the men therefore who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

name: Acts 1:22
text: beginning from the baptism of John, to the day that he was received up from us, of these one must become a witness with us of his resurrection."

name: Acts 1:23
text: They put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

name: Acts 1:24
text: They prayed, and said, "You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen

name: Acts 1:25
text: to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place."

name: Acts 1:26
text: They drew lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

name: Acts 2:1
text: Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place.

name: Acts 2:2
text: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

name: Acts 2:3
text: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.

name: Acts 2:4
text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.

name: Acts 2:5
text: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky.

name: Acts 2:6
text: When this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language.

name: Acts 2:7
text: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, "Behold, aren"t all these who speak Galileans?

name: Acts 2:8
text: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?

name: Acts 2:9
text: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,

name: Acts 2:10
text: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,

name: Acts 2:11
text: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!"

name: Acts 2:12
text: They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying one to another, "What does this mean?"

name: Acts 2:13
text: Others, mocking, said, "They are filled with new wine."

name: Acts 2:14
text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, "You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.

name: Acts 2:15
text: For these aren"t drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.

name: Acts 2:16
text: But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:

name: Acts 2:17
text: "It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.

name: Acts 2:18
text: Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.

name: Acts 2:19
text: I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and billows of smoke.

name: Acts 2:20
text: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.

name: Acts 2:21
text: It will be, that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved."

name: Acts 2:22
text: "Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him in the midst of you, even as you yourselves know,

name: Acts 2:23
text: him, being delivered up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by the hand of lawless men, crucified and killed;

name: Acts 2:24
text: whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it.

name: Acts 2:25
text: For David says concerning him, "I saw the Lord always before my face, For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.

name: Acts 2:26
text: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope;

name: Acts 2:27
text: because you will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay.

name: Acts 2:28
text: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence."

name: Acts 2:29
text: "Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

name: Acts 2:30
text: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,

name: Acts 2:31
text: he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was his soul left in Hades, nor did his flesh see decay.

name: Acts 2:32
text: This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses.

name: Acts 2:33
text: Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear.

name: Acts 2:34
text: For David didn"t ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, "The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit by my right hand,

name: Acts 2:35
text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.""

name: Acts 2:36
text: "Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified."

name: Acts 2:37
text: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, "Brothers, what shall we do?"

name: Acts 2:38
text: Peter said to them, "Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

name: Acts 2:39
text: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself."

name: Acts 2:40
text: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, "Save yourselves from this crooked generation!"

name: Acts 2:41
text: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls.

name: Acts 2:42
text: They continued steadfastly in the apostles" teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.

name: Acts 2:43
text: Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.

name: Acts 2:44
text: All who believed were together, and had all things in common.

name: Acts 2:45
text: They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need.

name: Acts 2:46
text: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart,

name: Acts 2:47
text: praising God, and having favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.

name: Acts 3:1
text: Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

name: Acts 3:2
text: A certain man who was lame from his mother"s womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.

name: Acts 3:3
text: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy.

name: Acts 3:4
text: Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said, "Look at us."

name: Acts 3:5
text: He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them.

name: Acts 3:6
text: But Peter said, "Silver and gold have I none, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!"

name: Acts 3:7
text: He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength.

name: Acts 3:8
text: Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God.

name: Acts 3:9
text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.

name: Acts 3:10
text: They recognized him, that it was he who used to sit begging for gifts for the needy at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. They were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

name: Acts 3:11
text: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon"s, greatly wondering.

name: Acts 3:12
text: When Peter saw it, he responded to the people, "You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?

name: Acts 3:13
text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.

name: Acts 3:14
text: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,

name: Acts 3:15
text: and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.

name: Acts 3:16
text: By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

name: Acts 3:17
text: "Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers.

name: Acts 3:18
text: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.

name: Acts 3:19
text: "Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord,

name: Acts 3:20
text: and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before,

name: Acts 3:21
text: whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.

name: Acts 3:22
text: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, "The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you.

name: Acts 3:23
text: It will be, that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people."

name: Acts 3:24
text: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.

name: Acts 3:25
text: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, "In your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed."

name: Acts 3:26
text: God, having raised up his servant, Jesus, sent him to you first, to bless you, in turning away everyone of you from your wickedness."

name: Acts 4:1
text: As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them,

name: Acts 4:2
text: being upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

name: Acts 4:3
text: They laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was now evening.
